overview: Reveals a revolutionary chapter in Australian history, the Womenâ€™s Liberation Movement (1965 -1975). Interweaves fresh archival footage, personal photographs, memorabilia, and personal accounts from activists all around Australia to show how a daring and diverse group of women joined forces to defy the status quo, demand equality, and create profound social change. These women defined one of the greatest social movements of the 20th century, sometimes at great personal cost.
tagline: The Women who started a Feminist Revolution in Australia
title: Brazen Hussies
